RECORD.TEXT: HLGMC 058752 01/23/2000 12:00:00 AM DIS Report Status : DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : STIRESPARD , ACEE UNIT NUMBER : 351-84-79 01/23/2000 DISCHARGE DATE : 02/01/2000 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSES : 1. Metastatic breast cancer . 3. Deep venous thrombosis of the left lower extremity . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Compazine 10 mg PO q4-6h p.r.n. nausea Ativan 1 mg sublingually q4h nausea , anxiety . Nursing services with evaluation and treatment . Physical therapy services , evaluation and treatment . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : On the day she was seen for her regular office evaluation and treatment , she was noted to be very slightly confused , nauseated , vomiting , and dehydrated . Laboratory studies were obtained which showed that she was hypercalcemic and mildly azotemic . During this hospitalization with hydration and diuresis , her calcium fell to normal levels and her renal function corrected to normal . It was felt that the cause of her hypercalcemia is related to progression of metastatic breast cancer and possibly as a flare to Fareston . She complained of some pain in her left lower extremity . Fragmin will be continued as an outpatient until the Coumadin dose is established and then this can be discontinued . Lupron and Arimidex were continued .
